ProcessDescription.ows:Title: Near_analysis
ProcessDescription.ows:Abstract: This determines the distance from each feature in the Input Features to the nearest features in the Near Features within the Search Radius. Uses ArcObjects library - Analysis

Input.ows:Title: in features
Input.ows:Abstract: The feature class or layer containing features from which distances are calculated to each feature in the Near Features.

Input.ows:Title: near features
Input.ows:Abstract: The feature class or layer containing features from which distances are calculated to the closest feature in the Input Features. If multiple feature classes or layers are specified, an extra field named NEAR_FC will be added to the input feature class to identify which near feature class contains the closest feature.

Input.ows:Title: search radius
Input.ows:Abstract: The maximum distance between Input Features and Near Features for which distance and FID will be determined. If no Search Radius is specified, all Near Features will be used.

Input.ows:Title: location
Input.ows:Abstract: Determines whether the x,y coordinates of the nearest feature are added to the Input Features as well as NEAR_FID and NEAR_DIST. The new fields are NEAR_X and NEAR_Y. NO_LOCATION — The x,y coordinates or the nearest point are not saved. This is the default. LOCATION — Additional fields named NEAR_X and NEAR_Y will be added to the result. These fields will contain the x- and y-coordinates of the Near Features.

Input.ows:Title: angle
Input.ows:Abstract: Determines whether the angle between the near feature will be calculated and stored in the NEAR_ANGLE field. The angle value is measured in degrees, where one degree represents 1/360 of a circle, and fractions of a degree are represented as decimal points. Angles are measured from 180° to -180° ; 0° to the east, 90° to the north, 180° (-180° ) to the west, and -90° to the south. NO_ANGLE — The angle between the nearest point will not be saved. This is the default. ANGLE — A field named NEAR_ANGLE will be added to the result and will contain the angle from the Input to the nearest point on the Near Feature.

Output.ows:Title: modified input features
Output.ows:Abstract: The feature class or layer containing features from which distances are calculated to each feature in the Near Features.
